messageBody:
RE: [junit] Ordering Test _Output_ ?

Joi Ellis wrote:
> On Mon, 2 Apr 2001, Mathieu Gervais wrote:
>
> > I personnally hate when suddenly 20 tests fails and I have
> to inspect all of
> > that ouput to know where is possibly the problem. I would like an
> > error/failure in testMoneyEquals() to show *first* in the
> output. How to
> > implement this? The test writer could somehow specify a
> "level" for each
> > test (basic, mid, complex). That could be totally optionnal
> and thus not
> > change the current API. That would be *just a hint* from
> the test writer to
> > the person running the tests saying "hey, look there first".

[snip]
> If you wanted to do this "right", you could extend TestRunner
> and replace
> printFailures() with a version which sorts the enumeration
> based on whatever
> criteria you like.  Method name comes to mind as something
> easy to use.

Joi and Mathieu,

One possibility is to nest your tests. TestX can invoke TestY if it depends on that behaviour.

The other possibility is to run your tests more often. :) If you haven't changed much since the last successful run, you know what must have broken your tests even without inspecting the test output.

Robert.
